description.narrative: Enabling Environment :By 2022, GoM has strengthened political commitment and accountability, and technical and institutional capacity for scaling up safely managed WASH services that are adaptive to cyclical stress and shocks.

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

title.narrative: "Myanmar Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Water Sanitation and Hygiene)
UNICEF Programmes in Myanmar (Responding to Emergencies)
"UNICEF Programmes in Myanmar (Water Sanitation and Hygiene- WASH)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enabling Environment :By 2022, GoM has strengthened political commitment and accountability, and technical and institutional capacity for scaling up safely managed WASH services that are adaptive to cyclical stress and shocks.

description.narrative: National Sanitation Policy and Costed Implementation Plan are being finalized. Sector coordination group meetings at the national level and 7 States/ Regions organized. Identification of metadata indicators including WASH of National Indicator Framework/Myanmar Sustainable Development to set quality data criteria is being started. National baseline on safely managed water and sanitation services from the intercensal survey is being finalized. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/07/2020

title.narrative: Number of sustainability checks conducted with independent third party with related management response
Existence of water, sanitation and hygiene sector financing mechanism

actual.value: 2019:Budget review of rural water supply sector has already been initiated for better understanding of financing gap. It is expected to complete in Q1 of 2020. Sector financing plan and sector financial frameworks are in progress for rural sanitation and hygiene.

title.narrative: National strategy to eliminate open defecation available with a systemic approach to gender

actual.value: 2019:National Sanitation and Hygiene Policy and Costed Implementation Plan (2020-2030) document drafted which includes plan and strategies for elimination of open defecation. This is also in line with MSDP aiming at achieving 100%

title.narrative: Existence of water, sanitation and hygiene sector monitoring, evaluation and learning mechanism

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF has been providing support on capacity building of national level government partners mainly in accountability in WASH, periodic sector reviews, monitoring and service delivery. DRD has established rural water supply monitoring system and MOHS has established HMIS system which are still weak.

title.narrative: Existence of functioning sector coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene

actual.value: 2019:Coordination mechanism for humanitarian action exists and UNICEF is supporting to lead or co-lead the sector coordination role. National level WASH sector coordination meetings are regularly organized under the leadership of DRD. UNICEF provides secretariat support.

title.narrative: Existence of water, sanitation and hygiene sector capacity development mechanism

actual.value: 2019:Capacity development plans and technical capacity development of engineers (DRD), school teachers (MOE) and Basic Health Staff (MOHS) have already initiated as needed.

title.narrative: Existence of water, sanitation and hygiene sector planning mechanism

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF has been working closely with DRD, DPH and DBE at national and sub-national levels to strengthen WASH planning system at both State/Regional and Township levels.

title.narrative: Existence and implementation of national water, sanitation and hygiene sector policy and strategy

actual.value: 2019:With technical support from UNICEF, development of National Rural Sanitation Policy and Costed Implementation Plan (2020-2030) is progressing well. The Policy document is being finalized by the Task Force which is chaired by the Department of Public Health (DPH).
